Watch the full interview here:  https://www.young.senate.gov/newsroom/press-releases/young-discusses-yemen-border-security-underpaid-gi-bill-benefits-on-msnbcs-morning-joe … pic.twitter.com/DrW6QIBNDE

Watch my full floor speech on the humanitarian crisis in Yemen and the U.S. relationship with Saudi Arabia here: https://www.young.senate.gov/newsroom/press-releases/following-administration-briefing-young-announces-support-for-senate-joint-resolution-on-yemen …
Based on that history and those facts — as well as our national security interests and our humanitarian principles – I plan to support the Sanders/Lee resolution (SJRES 54) today.
Unfortunately, the administration has failed to fully utilize the leverage I have provided, and today’s briefing raised more questions than it answered.
Since March of 2017, I have worked to give the administration leverage with the Saudis to accomplish these outcomes. We must use all of that leverage immediately.

I have studied the situation in Yemen as closely as anyone in the Senate, & I believe the best way to oppose Iran in Yemen & stop ballistic missile attacks on our partners is to bring all parties to the negotiating table, end the civil war, & address the humanitarian crisis.
I’m heading to the @SenateFloor shortly to discuss my reaction to today’s #Yemen briefing with Secretaries Pompeo and Mattis.  https://floor.senate.gov/MediaPlayer.php?publish_id=20 …

I am working in the Senate to ensure that our nation honors its commitments to veterans, and forever honors their brave service. Please join me in thanking all #veterans today.
As a proud Marine, I have great respect and gratitude for the patriotic men and women who have served in our nation’s Armed Forces to defend our cherished freedoms.
Today we recognize America’s veterans for their dedicated service to our nation. #VeteransDay is a time to honor the sacrifices of all who have served, as well as the sacrifices of their families.
Honoring our veterans in Indianapolis today. pic.twitter.com/RUOUKK99ma

Just left @indianastate in Terre Haute where @SecretaryAcosta and I spoke about retirement security. More than 40 million people do not have access to any workplace retirement plan. We discussed ways to help Hoosiers save for the future. pic.twitter.com/GFGAtBzkpc
